Actualmente labora para una empresa procesadora de tabaco desempeñándose como asistente de bodega el cual consiste llevar registrado todo el inventario.

Con el financiamiento otorgado que se le otorgo lo destinara para gasto de trámite de titulo de la carrera de Lic., en administración de empresa. Elvio se muestra agradecido con ceprodel y kiva ya que a través del financiamiento es una manera de apoyar a todos aquellos jóvenes que tienen el buen deseo de superación y que a la vez se vuelve un poco difícil por la situación económica del país.
texts.en:
Elvio, 29, is single.  His profession is business administration.  He's from the beautiful city of Estelí and is a responsible, honest, and hardworking young man.  Currently he works for a tobacco-processing company as a warehouse assistant, which consists of checking all the inventory.

With the loan granted he'll pay the costs of the paperwork for his advanced degree in business administration.

Elvio is grateful to CEPRODEL and Kiva because the loan is a way of supporting all those young people who want to improve themselves but for whom the country's economic situation is a bit difficult.

loans.use: to pay the costs of the paperwork for his advanced degree

loans.name: Nurila

texts.ru: Нуриле 58 лет, вдов. Дети Нурилы уже взрослые и проживают отдельно. По хозяйству активно помогает старший сын. Нурила на протяжении 37 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 5,00 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Нурилы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 12 овец, 10 коз и 4 кобылы. Доходы от бизнес – деятельности Нурилы позволяют покрывать повседневные затраты семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурила обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 нетелей и 1 кобылы. Доходы от кредита Нурила планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины. В следующем году планирует открыть цех по обработке шерсти и создать рабочие места для сельских женщин.
texts.en:
Nurila is 58 years old and a widow. Nurila's children are already grown-ups and live by themselves. The eldest son actively helps her in her business. Nurila has been working with livestock breeding for a period of 37 years, after having started this business with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nurila's hard work, her farm has three cows, 12 sheep, 10 goats and four mares. The income from the business activities allows Nurila to cover the daily expenses of the family. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Nurila turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of two heifers and one mare. Nurila plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals. Next year she plans to open a store for processing wool and create jobs for rural women.

loans.use: To purchase 2 heifers and 1  horse

loans.name: Hotamkul

texts.ru: Хотамкул житель города Худжанд. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Хотамкул занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи для торговли. Таким образом Хотамкул зарабатывает на жизнь. Он берет кредит для посева картошки.
texts.en:
Hotamkul is a resident of the city of Khujand. He is 31 years old, and married. He has one child. Hotamkul works with crop production. He mainly grows vegetables for selling. This way Hotamkul earns money for living. 

Hotamkul takes a loan for the sowing of potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Leonidas es un hombre de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con es su esposa e hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos  económicos, Leonidas no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones su esposa cocina un riquísimo Seco de Res para engreírlo, ya que es su comida favorita.
Por iniciativa propia con mucho empeño y dedicación, Leonidas se dedica a la agricultura, él tiene una pequeña parcela en donde siembra tuna , Leonidas trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 6 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su experiencia.
Leonidas se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de infestación de su cultivo con cochinilla, de esta manera Leonidas espera tener una buena cosecha y aumentar su producción de cochinilla para su futura venta, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante y lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su terreno.
texts.en:
Leónidas, 48, lives in the city of Nazca with his wife and children who he loves and are his main reason for living.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic man who focuses all his efforts into moving his family forward.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources, Leónidas was unable to study a professional career but he would have liked to do so very much.  He likes listening to music in his free time and on occasion his wife cooks a delicious “Seco de Res” to pamper him since it’s his favorite dish.

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Leónidas works in agriculture.  He has a small parcel where he grows cactus apples.  He works every day starting very early in the morning and works for six hours.  He feels good doing his work and thinks he does well because of his experience.

Leónidas is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve provided he will be able to pay the costs of infesting his crops with cochineal.  Leónidas expects to have a good harvest and increase the cochineal production for future sale.  He will thus continue working and striving to get ahead and reach his dream of enlarging his land.

loans.use: to introduce cochineal into his crops.

loans.name: Bedeykan

texts.ru: Бедейкан 50 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей школьного возраста, почти все дети взрослые и обустроены,только 2 из сыновей живут с ней и учатся в школе лицеи. Бедейкан в качестве основного дохода с 1996 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 15,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бедейкан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коров, 8 голов лошадей. Помимо этого они с семьёй обрабатывают 5,99 га земли.  Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 5,000 KGS от полеводства и животноводства. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бедейкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Купленный скот поможет увеличить доходы, что позволить оплатить кредит.По планам Бедейкан, после погашения кредита ей останется корова как чистый доход.  Доходы от кредита Бедейкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, чтобы накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Bedeykan is 50 years old, she is married and is raising 2 school-aged children; almost all her children are adults and provided for, only 2 sons live with her and go to a lyceum school.  Bedeykan as a main source of income has been raising livestock since 1966, having started this business with 15,000 KGS.  Thanks to Bedeykan's hard work on her farm, today she has 3 cows and 8 horses.  In addition, she and her family work 5.99 hectares of land.  Her monthly income from the business is 5,000 KGS from farming and livestock.  In order to further grow her business Bedeykan turned to "Bai-Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock.  The newly acquired livestock will help Bedeykan increase her profits, and after paying off her loan she will keep a cow as a net profit.  Bedeykan plans to invest the profits from the loan into further increasing her domestic livestock count in order to save money to remodel her home.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Kanybek

texts.ru: Каныбеку 43 года, женат, имеет 3 детей. Супруга Каныбека работает библиотекарем в местной библиотеке . В 1993 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Каныбек начал свой бизнес в животноводстве. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Каныбека, начатое с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство, на сегодняшний день приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов и насчитывает две головы коровы, 16 голов коз, 6 голов рвец и одного жеребца. Доходы от бизнес – деятельности позволили Каныбеку оплатить обучение для троих старших детей. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Каныбек обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 68,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. В планах - вложить доходы в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в будущем – накопить сумму для оплаты обучения на следующий год.
texts.en:
Kanybek is 43 years old, married, and has three children. Kanybek's wife works as a librarian at the local library. In 1993, in search of an income for the family, Kanybek started his business of livestock breeding. Thanks to Kanybek's persistence and perseverance, having started the business with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS), the farm currently brings in around 10,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and meat products, and now counts two cows, 16 heads of goats, 6 heads of sheep and one stallion. The income from the business helped Kanybek to pay for the education of his eldest children. 

With an aim to further increase the number of cattle, Kanybek turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 68,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cattle. He plans to save up the income from further increasing the number of household animals.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Akbermet

texts.ru: Акбермет это полное имя заемщика, Бермет короткое имя.Бермет 56 лет, вдова,дети Бермет уже взрослые и самостоятельные. Бермет с 1979 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,00 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день у Бермет имеется очень развитое и хорошее хозяйство. Доходы от бизнеса позволили ей оплачивать все расходы семьи.  Доходы позволили Бермет создать необходимую базу для детей для создания их собственных семей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бермет обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения прибыли от продажи молока. Доходы Бермет планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Akbermet is the borrower's full name, but she goes by Bermet. Bermet is a 56-year-old widow with grown and independent children. Since 1979 Bermet has been working in animal husbandry. She started this business with 5,000 KGS. Now, Bermet has a developed and very well managed farm. Her earnings allowed her to pay all the family's expenses. This profit allowed Bermet create the necessary framework for her children to start their own families. In order to further expand her business, she turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy cows, and to increase her profit from the sale of milk. Bermet plans to invest her earnings into expanding her farm.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Nerwaya Group

texts.fr:
Mme DJENEBOU est responsable du groupe  NERWAYA. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgés à 09 ans. 02 vont  à l’école et elle a 02 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes et chaussures depuis 05ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Sankansé. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 15 pièces de pagnes et 03 douzaines de chaussures.
Elle  veut  utiliser  ses bénéfices pour s’acheter une moto. Mme  ambitionne agrandir son  champ d’activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. DJENEBOU is the leader of the group NERWAYA. She is a married mother of two children aged 9 and 13 who both go to school. She is supporting two people. 

Mrs. Djenebou has been selling pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) and shoes for five years. She buys her merchandise at the market of Sankansé. Her customers are men and women. 

She plans to buy 15 pagnes and three dozen shoes. She will use her profits to buy a motorcycle. Her goal is to broaden her field of activity and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 15 pagnes and 3 dozen shoes for resale.

loans.name: Turdububu

texts.ru: Турдубубу 46 лет, замужем, воспитала шесть детей. Старший сын Турдубубу женат и у него двое детей.старшая дочка учится в университете, остальные дети маленькие двое учатся в школе и двое еще дошкольного возраста. Турдубубу на протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Турдубубу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы,12 голов овец, 4 козы и 2 лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Турдубубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота, что позволит ей увеличить доходы от перепродажи. На полученные доходы от кредита Турдубубу планирует оплатить учебу дочки.
texts.en: Turdububu is 46 years old, married, and is raising six children. Turdububu's eldest son is married and has two children. Her oldest daughter goes to the university.  She has two school-aged children, and two more of pre-school age. Turdububu has been breeding livestock for more than ten years. She started this business with 10,000 KGS. Through Turdububu's hard work, her farm now has two cows, twelve sheep, four goats and two horses. In order to further expand her business, Turdububu turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase additional cattle. This will allow her to increase her revenue from reselling them. She plans to use the money she makes from her loan to pay for her daughter's studies.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mahmadnosir

texts.ru:
Махмадносир проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Махмадносир вместе со всей семьей занимается животноводством. Он у себя дома разводит крупнорогатый скот. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается 14 лет. 
Махмадносир берет кредит для закупа коров.
texts.en: Mahmadnosir lives in the city of Khujand. He is 38 years old, married, and has two children. Mahmadnosir and his entire fmaily work in animal husbandry. He breeds cattle at home. He has been doing this for fourteen years. Mahmadnosir is taking out a loan to purchase cows.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es: Flor de María, tiene 34 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Su actividad de negocio es la venta de mercadería, desde hace 3 años vende ropa como blusas, camisas, lociones, sandalias etc. las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante, ofrece en su comunidad y a su alrededor. Ella quiere comprar mas mercadería para surtir y cumplir con los pedidos de los clientes, para eso ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 20,000 lempiras. Va comprar más ropa como blusas, camisas, y zapatos. Su sueño es administrar bien el negocio para obtener ganancias y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Flor de María, 34, is married and has two children; she lives in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara.  Her business activity is selling merchandise.  For the last three years she’s been selling clothes like blouses, shirts, lotions, sandals, etc.  She sells from place to place in her community and surrounding areas.  She wants to buy more merchandise to stock up and fill customer orders which is why she’s decided to ask for a 20,000 Lempira loan.  She is going to buy more clothes like blouses, shirts and shoes.  Her dream is to manage the business well to earn profits and provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Louyei

texts.en:
Over the past two years, Louyei has still been selling mats and brooms in Kitale and the business is doing great in that her monthly income has increased to KES. 8,000, which she uses to support her family.

Louyei paid her her previous loan well and in good time and she is borrowing a school fees loan with which she wants to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase baking trays and expand his baking business.

loans.name: Turdihol

texts.ru:
Турдихол трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 52лет.  Она замужем и имеет 4 детей.  Турдихол  живет в  деревне со своей семьей. У нее также имеются 6 внуков.   У них очень дружная и трудолюбивая семья.  Они все вместе занимаются откормом скота. Это их семейный бизнес и единственный доход в семье.  
 Ее сын занимается куплей продажей скота, а Турдихол с невесткой доят корову и продают молоко и молочные продукты  соседям и знакомым. У них имеются две дойные коровы.  Этот вид деятельности им очень нравиться и они с удовольствием этим занимаются. 
 На полученный кредит Турдихол хочет приобрести еще одну дойную корову, так как от продажи молочных продуктов у нее хороший доход и очень большой спрос. Она очень благодарит организацию Кива за финансовую помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Turdihol is a hardworking woman of the age of 52. She is married and has four children. Turdihol lives in a village with her family. She has 6 grandchildren as well. They are a very friendly and hardworking family. They all work with fattening cattle together. This is their family business and the only income for the family. Her son works with purchasing and selling livestock, and Turdihol milks the cows together with her sister in law and sells milk and dairy products to neighbors and contacts. They have two dairy cows. This type of business they like very much and they gladly work with this. 

For the loan received, Turdihol wants to purchase an additional dairy cow, as there is a good income and high demand for the sales of dairy products. She is very thankful to the Kiva organization for the financial help and support.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Erkin

texts.ru:
Эркин житель города Худжанд. Ему 27 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Эркин живет с родителями. Его жена домохозяйка. Мать Эркина вместе с его сестрой работаю на рынке. Его отец работает в средней школе, электриком. Эркин имеет средне - специальное образование, он шафер. 
Эркин вот уже девять лет работает по специальности. Он предоставляет услугу по маршруту №113. Также он зарабатывает электриком по найму. Эркин берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля.
texts.en:
Erkin is a resident of the city of Khujand. He is 27 years old, and married. He has a child. Erkin lives with his parents. His wife is a housewife. 

Erkin's mother and sister work at the market. His father works as an electrician at a high school Erkin has secondary specialized education, he is a driver. Erkin has worked as this for 10 years already. He provides a service on route 113. Further he earns money as an electrician for hire. 

Erkin takes a loan for the repair of his ca.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi, 54, lives in her own house. She works selling coconuts from her home. She’s been in business several years and has gained much experience in sales. Thanks to this, she earns better profits. She is a very hard-working woman, despite her advanced age.

Chizi is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and who has many goals she wants to reach. She wants to earn a more profitable future for herself and to work hard to reach the success she so desires.

Chizi is asking for this loan to purchase more stock of coconuts for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a hairdresser in Effia Kumah, near Takoradi. She has received schooling through a senior high school level. She is single and has two children. Esther has been a hairdresser for eight years. She is responsible for supporting herself and her children. 

Her loan will be used to purchase hair extensions, creams, and lotions that her clients demand. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her hair salon.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, creams, and lotions that her clients demand.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort sells food stuffs in Effia Kumah, near Takoradi. Comfort has received a trade school education. She is married and has four children. Comfort has been selling food stuffs for eight years now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the family's general expenses. 

Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity and variety of food stuffs to sell in the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her food-selling trade.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity and variety of food stuffs to sell in the market.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur, who is from the town of Yeghegnadzor, lives with his wife and two small children. In addition to working as a driver for a local company, Artur is involved in agriculture. He currently has livestock consisting of 10 cows and 16 chickens, and, with the help of his wife, also maintains an orchard comprised of peach, apricot, cherry, nut, apple and pear trees. Artur sells the gathered harvest to local market traders, which helps him to cover the family's basic costs.

In order to feed the livestock, Artur has requested this loan to purchase forage. This will enable him to ensure his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy forage for his livestock.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia, a married mother of two, has been selling provisions in Effia Kumah near Takoradi for the past 20 years. Emelia's husband is retired and receives a pension that contributes to the family’s income, but she is responsible for supporting him in paying the family's general expenses.

Emelia's loan will be used to buy an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell. She hopes to use the resulting new profits to further expand her shop.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity and variety of provisions to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish to re-sell

loans.name: Zippy

texts.en:
Zippy lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is the training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has 3 children and has been farming for 15 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is keeping poultry and dairy cows!  Her biggest challenge is being able to feed the birds due to high costs of feed.   Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'mrembo nand maua".  She will use the loan to buy poultry birds. 
Zipporah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied that she learned of Juhudi from a friend.  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session and she replied that she has leared how to boost working capital through micro finance.

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Zippy replied that it will bring increased income from poultry sales.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Zipporah owns the following: 'cow, poultry, and automobile' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, or motorcycle'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, running water, and tv, but does not have 'electricity, sewing machine, or DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is 44 years old.  She is married and has two children, aged 22 and 20. Many years ago, she established  her vegetable farming  business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business. 

 In the future, Sani plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

 Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is from Gndevaz village of Vayots Dzor region. She lives with her husband and is involved in agriculture. Together with her husband, Susanna keeps livestock which currently includes a cow and 15 chickens. She gets milk, uses it in cheese production and sells it to local market traders. As agriculture helps Susanna to get stable monthly income, she would like to expand it. 

Susanna has applied for this loan to purchase a heifer and 20 chickens. This will help her to earn more income and ensure her and her husband's livelihood.

loans.use: to pay for a heifer and 20 chickens

location.town: Gndevaz village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit has been involved in beekeeping for more than ten years. She keeps 19 colonies of bees and gets high-quality honey. She also keeps an orchard where peach, apricot, cherry, apple and pear trees are grown. She works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it to local market traders. 

The agricultural business is the sole financial income for Lilit and her family, so she would like to expand it. Lilit has applied for this loan to purchase a cow and colonies of bees. This will enable her to gather more income and cover the family's basic needs.

Lilit lives with her son, Hovhannes (32 years old), and daughter, Hasmik (30 years old. Lilit hopes that the loan will help her to secure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and colonies of bees.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is married and has four children. She has received schooling through primary school level. Ekua sells plantain chips in Effia Kumah near Takoradi, which she has done for the last 10 years. Her husband is a driver in the area. 

Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in paying the family's general expenses. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more plantains, oil and other supplies necessary to make plantain chips. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to grow her plantain chip trade.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains, oil and other supplies necessary to make plantain chips.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati is married and has four children. She has received schooling through senior high school. 

Fati sells herbal medicine in Effia Kumah near Takoradi and has done so for the past 30 years. Her husband is a driver. Fati uses her income to support her husband in paying the family's general expenses. 

Fati will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity and variety of herbs and natural products to prepare her medicines. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fati plans to develop her herbal medicine shop further.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity and variety of herbs and natural products to prepare her medicines.

loans.name: Alma Clementina

texts.es: Alma tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos uno de ellos vive con ella en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Doña Alma tiene 3 años de tener el negocio de venta de comida, almuerzos y cenas, vende sopas, carne asada, pollo horneado y pollo frito con tajadas. Ha obtenido muy buenos resultados con este negocio al cual le ha invertido varios préstamos.  El que solicita actualmente es por 10,000 lempiras y es el cuarto ciclo con ODEF, este lo utilizara para comprar insumos como carnes, vegetales, harina, manteca, refrescos, condimentos, granos básicos etc.  Ella quiere mantener más productos en inventario para hacer variedad de comidas y aumentar las ventas. Su sueño es ver su negocio en crecimiento para lograr  mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alma is 46 years old, a single mother, and has two children; one of whom lives with her, in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. For three years, Alma has had a business selling food: lunches and dinners. She sells soups, grilled meat, baked chicken, and fried chicken with plantain.

She is getting good results with this business, in which she has invested several loans. The one she is currently requesting is for 10,000 lempiras, and is her fourth with ODEF. She will use this to buy ingredients such as meats, vegetables, flour, lard, soft drink, condiments, staple grains, etc. 

She wants to keep more products in inventory so that she can make a variety of meals and increase her sales. Her dream is to see her business grow, so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as basic staples, meats, soft drinks, flour, condiments and vegetables for making meals.

loans.name: Nakali

texts.en:
Nakali is 45 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 24 and 20.  In 2000, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 8 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  

In the future, Nakali plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

 In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called  'pasal', are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical 'pasal' might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Fenita

texts.en:
Fenita is a seamstress in Effia Kumah near Takoradi. Fenita has received school through senior high school.  She is married and has one child. Her husband is on the cocoa board and works to regulate cocoa in Ghana.

Fenita has been a seamstress for eight years now. She is responsible for helping to support her husband in paying the family's general expenses. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity and variety of material and sewing supplies. 

Fenita hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her seamstress shop.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity and variety of material and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Dus Maya

texts.en:
Dus Maya is 34 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 14 and 11.  

In 2002, Dus Maya established her brass religious statues-making business. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business.  

In the future, Dus Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone.  

With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a hairdresser in Effia Kumah near Takoradi. She has attended school through senior high school. She is single and has no children. 

Florence has been a hairdresser for four years. She is responsible for paying to support herself and paying all her own bills. Her loan will be used to buy hair extensions, creams and lotions that her clients demand. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her hair salon.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, creams and lotions that her clients demand.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married with two children and both go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  

Janet has a business of a clinic and has been in this business for eight years. She generates additional income from a restaurant. 

Janet has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of tablets, syrups and syringes. She works from a shop that she rents seven days out of every week, and she sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

Janet aspires to turn her clinic into a fully stocked health centre and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of syrups, tablets and syringes.

loans.name: Jaloliddin

texts.ru: Чалолиддин житель района Рудаки. Ему 38 лет. Он женат, отец четверых детей. Чалолиддин единственный кормилец семьи. У него есть собственный магазин, где он продает аудио диски, устройства для телефонов. Кроме торговли он еще занимается животноводством. Чалолиддин очень целеустремленный человек. По его словам, он раньше был крупным бизнесменом, в его обороте было большое количество товаров, однако его бизнес сгорел. Но несмотря на крах, он начал все с нуля. Сейчас Чалолиддин хочет расширить свой бизнес и еще раз добиться успеха. Он берет кредит для приобретения мобильных телефонов с целью увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Jaloliddin is a resident of the Rudaki region.  He is 38 years old.  He is married and is the father of four children.  Jaloliddin is the sole provider in his family.  He has his own store where he sells CDs and mobile phone accessories.  In addition to sales he also raises livestock.  Jaloliddin is a very goal oriented person.  According to him, he was previously a big businessman and had a large inventory, but his business burned down.  But despite the crash he started again with nothing.  Right now Jaloliddin would like to expand his business and again achieve success.  He is taking out a loan to acquire mobile phones in order to increase his product assortment.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones in ordre to increase his product assortment

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is married with seven children and all her children go to school. She has a business selling used shoes and has applied for a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more used shoes. She has been in this business for 5 years and works seven days a week. She works at the market and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Noelina

texts.en: Noelina is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling used shoes. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. She has been in this business for eight years and works at the market seven days a week but on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат проживает со своей семьей в городе Истаравшан. Ей 44 года. Она совместно с мужем занимается животноводством уже 12 лет. Малохат энергичная женщина и трудится наравне с мужем. Она хочет расширить свою деятельность и просит кредит на сумму 3000 долларов для купли-продажи крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Malohat lives with her family in the city of Istaravshan.  She is 44 years old.  She has been raising livestock with her husband for 12 years.  Malohat is an energetic woman and works alongside her husband.  She would like to expand her business and is asking for a loan of 3000 dollars for the buying and selling of cattle.

loans.use: to buy and sell livestock

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses' business is doing quite well in its second year. He bought retail stock form the first loan and realized high sales which enabled him to complete the repayments on time.

His dream of opening a wholesale business is on course and he testifies that the decision to quit casual employment and start a business from his accumulated savings is now paying off. 

Moses is applying for a loan of 83,450 Kenyan Shillings to purchase more wholesale retail stock of products such as sugar, cooking fat, tea leaves and soap. He now desires to open another retail outlet and looks forward to earning more income to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale retail stock of products such as sugar, cooking fat, tea leaves and soap.
